results.title: Comparing Simvastatin Monotherapy V/S Simvastatin-Ezetimibe Combination Therapy for the Treatment of Hyperlipidemia: A Meta-Analysis and Review
results.text_hl: Comparing @CHEMICAL_Simvastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@Simvastatin@@@ Monotherapy V/S @<m>CHEMICAL_Ezetimibe_Simvastatin_Drug_Combination</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000069499 @@@Simvastatin-Ezetimibe@@@ Combination Therapy for the Treatment of @<m>DISEASE_Hyperlipidemias</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006949 @@@Hyperlipidemia@@@: A Meta-Analysis and Review

citations.NLM: Chauhan D, Memon F, Patwardhan V, Kotwani P, Shah P, Samala Venkata V. Comparing Simvastatin Monotherapy V/S Simvastatin-Ezetimibe Combination Therapy for the Treatment of Hyperlipidemia: A Meta-Analysis and Review Cureus. 2022 Nov;14(11):e31007. PMID: 36475227

results.title: Long-term safety and efficacy of triple combination ezetimibe/simvastatin plus extended-release niacin in patients with hyperlipidemia.
results.text_hl: In conclusion, the combination of @<m>CHEMICAL_Ezetimibe_Simvastatin_Drug_Combination</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000069499 @@@E/S@@@ plus @CHEMICAL_Niacin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D009525 @@@niacin@@@ was generally well tolerated, aside from @CHEMICAL_Niacin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D009525 @@@niacin@@@-associated @DISEASE_Flushing @DISEASE_MESH:D005483 @@@flushing@@@, and was significantly superior to @<m>CHEMICAL_Ezetimibe_Simvastatin_Drug_Combination</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000069499 @@@E/S@@@ alone in improving several lipoprotein parameters during a 64-week trial in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @<m>DISEASE_Hyperlipidemias</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006949 @@@hyperlipidemia@@@.

citations.NLM: Fazio S, Guyton JR, Polis AB, Adewale AJ, Tomassini JE, Ryan NW, Tershakovec AM. Long-term safety and efficacy of triple combination ezetimibe/simvastatin plus extended-release niacin in patients with hyperlipidemia. Am J Cardiol. 2010 Feb 15;105(4):487-94. PMID: 20152243
citations.BibTeX: @article{20152243, title={Long-term safety and efficacy of triple combination ezetimibe/simvastatin plus extended-release niacin in patients with hyperlipidemia.}, author={Fazio S and Guyton JR and Polis AB and Adewale AJ and Tomassini JE and Ryan NW and Tershakovec AM}, journal={Am J Cardiol}, volume={105}, number={4}, pages={487-94}}

results.title: Drug Class Review: Fixed Dose Combination Drug Products for the Treatment of Type 2 Diabetes and Hyperlipidemia: Final Report

results.title: Changes in Lipoprotein Particle Number With Ezetimibe/Simvastatin Coadministered With Extended-Release Niacin in Hyperlipidemic Patients
results.text_hl: In conclusion, @<m>CHEMICAL_Ezetimibe_Simvastatin_Drug_Combination</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000069499 @@@E/S@@@+@CHEMICAL_Nitrogen @CHEMICAL_MESH:D009584 @@@N@@@ therapy reduced LDL-P and increased HDL-P more than @CHEMICAL_Nitrogen @CHEMICAL_MESH:D009584 @@@N@@@ or @<m>CHEMICAL_Ezetimibe_Simvastatin_Drug_Combination</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000069499 @@@E/S@@@ monotherapy in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with mixed @<m>DISEASE_Hyperlipidemias</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006949 @@@hyperlipidemia@@@.

citations.NLM: Le NA, Jin R, Tomassini JE, Tershakovec AM, Neff DR, Wilson PW. Changes in Lipoprotein Particle Number With Ezetimibe/Simvastatin Coadministered With Extended-Release Niacin in Hyperlipidemic Patients J Am Heart Assoc. 2013 Aug 7;2(4):e000037. PMID: 23926117
citations.BibTeX: @article{23926117, title={Changes in Lipoprotein Particle Number With Ezetimibe/Simvastatin Coadministered With Extended-Release Niacin in Hyperlipidemic Patients}, author={Le NA and Jin R and Tomassini JE and Tershakovec AM and Neff DR and Wilson PW}, journal={J Am Heart Assoc}, volume={2}, number={4}, pages={e000037}}

results.title: Lipid-altering efficacy and safety of ezetimibe/simvastatin coadministered with extended-release niacin in patients with type IIa or type IIb hyperlipidemia.
results.text_hl: CONCLUSIONS: Combination treatment with @<m>CHEMICAL_Ezetimibe_Simvastatin_Drug_Combination</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000069499 @@@E/S@@@ plus @CHEMICAL_Nitrogen @CHEMICAL_MESH:D009584 @@@N@@@ showed superior @CHEMICAL_Lipids @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008055 @@@lipid@@@-altering efficacy compared with @CHEMICAL_Nitrogen @CHEMICAL_MESH:D009584 @@@N@@@ or @<m>CHEMICAL_Ezetimibe_Simvastatin_Drug_Combination</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000069499 @@@E/S@@@ in @<m>DISEASE_Hyperlipidemias</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006949 @@@type IIa or IIb hyperlipidemia@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ and was generally well tolerated aside from @CHEMICAL_Nitrogen @CHEMICAL_MESH:D009584 @@@N@@@-associated @DISEASE_Flushing @DISEASE_MESH:D005483 @@@flushing@@@.

citations.NLM: Guyton JR, Brown BG, Fazio S, Polis A, Tomassini JE, Tershakovec AM. Lipid-altering efficacy and safety of ezetimibe/simvastatin coadministered with extended-release niacin in patients with type IIa or type IIb hyperlipidemia. J Am Coll Cardiol. 2008 Apr 22;51(16):1564-72. PMID: 18420099
citations.BibTeX: @article{18420099, title={Lipid-altering efficacy and safety of ezetimibe/simvastatin coadministered with extended-release niacin in patients with type IIa or type IIb hyperlipidemia.}, author={Guyton JR and Brown BG and Fazio S and Polis A and Tomassini JE and Tershakovec AM}, journal={J Am Coll Cardiol}, volume={51}, number={16}, pages={1564-72}}
